responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: Improper Input Validation (CWE-20)
    analysis: |
      The code in the provided codebase does not properly validate user input, which can lead to various security vulnerabilities such as command injection, SQL injection, and cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks. The code should implement input validation mechanisms to ensure that all user input is properly sanitized and validated before being used in any sensitive operations.
    cwe: CWE-20
    function_names:
      - lib/Horde/Image/Exif.php
      - lib/Horde/Image/Exif/Parser/Canon.php
      - lib/Horde/Image/Exif/Parser/Fujifilm.php
    filenames:
      - lib/Horde/Image/Exif.php
      - lib/Horde/Image/Exif/Parser/Canon.php
      - lib/Horde/Image/Exif/Parser/Fujifilm.php
    classification: slightly promising

  - headline: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation (CWE-79)
    analysis: |
      The code in the provided codebase does not properly sanitize user input before displaying it in the generated web pages. This can lead to cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities, where an attacker can inject malicious scripts into the page and have them executed by the victim's web browser. The code should implement input validation and output encoding mechanisms to ensure that all user input is properly sanitized before being displayed in the web pages.
    cwe: CWE-79
    function_names:
      - lib/Horde/Image/Exif.php
      - lib/Horde/Image/Exif/Parser/Canon.php
      - lib/Horde/Image/Exif/Parser/Fujifilm.php
    filenames:
      - lib/Horde/Image/Exif.php
      - lib/Horde/Image/Exif/Parser/Canon.php
      - lib/Horde/Image/Exif/Parser/Fujifilm.php
    classification: slightly promising

  - headline: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command (CWE-78)
    analysis: |
      The code in the provided codebase does not properly sanitize user input before using it in OS commands. This can lead to OS command injection vulnerabilities, where an attacker can inject malicious commands into the input and have them executed by the system. The code should implement input validation mechanisms to ensure that all user input is properly sanitized before being used in any OS commands.
    cwe: CWE-78
    function_names:
      - lib/Horde/Image/Exif.php
    filenames:
      - lib/Horde/Image/Exif.php
    classification: slightly promising
```

leads.headline: Improper Input Validation (CWE-20)
leads.analysis: The code in the provided codebase does not properly validate user input, which can lead to various security vulnerabilities such as command injection, SQL injection, and cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks. The code should implement input validation mechanisms to ensure that all user input is properly sanitized and validated before being used in any sensitive operations.

leads.headline: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation (CWE-79)
leads.analysis: The code in the provided codebase does not properly sanitize user input before displaying it in the generated web pages. This can lead to cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities, where an attacker can inject malicious scripts into the page and have them executed by the victim's web browser. The code should implement input validation and output encoding mechanisms to ensure that all user input is properly sanitized before being displayed in the web pages.

leads.headline: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command (CWE-78)
leads.analysis: The code in the provided codebase does not properly sanitize user input before using it in OS commands. This can lead to OS command injection vulnerabilities, where an attacker can inject malicious commands into the input and have them executed by the system. The code should implement input validation mechanisms to ensure that all user input is properly sanitized before being used in any OS commands.
